top_categories.workout_context: Grinduro California's Sierra Nevada singletrack (50%), Gravel roads (30%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 60 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Grinduro California's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
6,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Grinduro California, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
108ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Grinduro California, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
60 miles on sierra Nevada enduro—singletrack descents + burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on sierra Nevada enduro—singletrack descents +. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Grinduro California. Train it until it feels boring.
6,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Smooth pedaling at 60 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
Low-cadence force work for 6,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Grinduro California’s 60 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Grinduro California. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Grinduro California demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride sierra nevada enduro—singletrack descents + gravel climbs at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: sierra nevada singletrack (50%), gravel roads (30%), dirt roads (20%). Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 60 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 60 miles of sierra nevada enduro—singletrack descents + gravel climbs in Quincy, California (Plumas County).
